description.narrative: The expected development impact derives from increased access to finance for SMEs in Belarus which have been negatively affected by the COVID 19 global pandemic and ensuing economic slowdown. IFC's funds will be used to provide working capital lines to eligible SMEs in the country, helping these companies to sustain their operations during the economic slowdown. In addition, by sustaining banks' ability to provide funding to SMEs, the project intends to promote the resilience of trade finance markets as well as broader stability that comes about by providing for the going concern of market participants in Belarus.

The project is a senior loan of up to US$25 million equivalent in Belarusian Rubble to Priorbank Joint-Stock Company (Priorbank, or the Bank), an existing IFC client in Belarus. The loan will have a tenor of 12 months with the possibility of extension by another 12-month period. The funds will be used to support SMEs in Belarus which have been negatively impacted by the COVID 19 global pandemic.

mailing-address.narrative: Priorbank Joint Stock Company Denis Pekun Head of FI denis.pekun@priorbank.by

name.narrative: Priorbank is headquartered in Minsk, Belarus, and provides finance-related services to customers across the country.
